did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Irving Rosenthal papers

physdesc.label: Collection Size
physdesc.extent: ca. 23 linear ft. (32 manuscript boxes, 1 half box, 7 flat boxes, 1 tube)

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.abstract: The papers document Irving Rosenthal's life from his childhood onwards, containing outgoing correspondence, doctoral dissertation materials, manuscript materials, and detailed documentation of his own novel, Sheeper. There are materials relating to his editorship of The Chicago Review and Big Table, his trip to Cuba in 1961, and his life in Tangier from 1962-1964. Also included are manuscripts by, and correspondence with, William Burroughs, Edward Dahlberg, Herbert Huncke, Allen Ginsberg, and Jack Smith. Other significant figures featured in the collection include Paul Bowles, Paul Carroll, Gregory Corso, Elsa Dorfman, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, George Harris III, Jack Kerouac, Eila Kokkinen, Robert LaVigne, Phillip Lamantia, Edward Marshall, Michael McClure, Peter Orlovsky, Ed Sanders, Philip Whalen, and John Wieners.
did.physloc: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research, except half box 40, which is closed until 01/01/2014; materials must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Irving Rosenthal papers, M1550. Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was purchased by Stanford University, Special Collections in December 2006. Accession 2005-126

bioghist.head: Biography / Administrative History
bioghist.p: Irving Rosenthal was born in San Francisco on October 9, 1930. He attended Pomona College and then the University of Chicago, where he did graduate work in human development.

In the late 1950s, Rosenthal became editor of The Chicago Review and succeeded in publishing poetry by Jack Kerouac, prose by Edward Dahlberg, and the first parts of William Burroughs's Naked Lunch before the University of Chicago censored his editorial practice. After resigning from The Chicago Review, he moved to New York and started Big Table magazine with the help of a colleague. Its first issue included the entire contents of the suppressed 1959 winter edition of The Chicago Review. Although Big Table survived only briefly, its few issues strengthened Rosenthal's connection to both the Dahlberg circle and the Beats.

Living in New York, Rosenthal developed particularly close relationships with Allen Ginsberg, Hubert Huncke, and other figures in the Beat movement. He subsequently visited Burroughs and Paul Bowles in Tangier and lived there from 1962 to1964. During this period he also began work on a novel, Sheeper, which was later published by Grove Press in 1967. Returning to New York, Rosenthal was drawn into the orbit of the experimental film maker, Jack Smith, and appeared in Flaming Creatures and No President.
In 1967 Rosenthal moved back to San Francisco with George Harris, founder of the Cockettes, to start the Kaliflower commune, which continues to exist and where he still lives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The collection contains correspondence, manuscripts, typescripts, photographs, artwork, periodicals, and ephemera. Folder numbers consist of the "box number.folder number," e.g. "1.12."

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in FOUR series:

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: American literature- -20th century.
Beat generation.
controlaccess.title: Kerouac, Jack, 1922-1969. Old Angel Midnight
Burroughs, William S., 1914-1997. Naked lunch
Huncke, Herbert. Huncke's journal
Rosenthal, Irving, 1930- Sheeper; "the poet! the crooked! the extra-fingered!"
Chicago review.
Big table.

did.unittitle: Series I. PERSONAL

scopecontent.p: This series contains materials from Rosenthal's childhood, college years, early jobs, personal interests, and travels.

did.unittitle: Agnews State Hospital, 1951: materials from summer job at Agnews State Hospital; includes an evaluation of his experience.
Athens, Greece, 1964: materials from stay; includes letters, tickets, business cards, receipts, notes, and map.
Autobiographical statements and resumes, 1952-1965
Bankbooks, 1948-1967
Beads, 1963: correspondence with bead sellers regarding business Rosenthal tried to start in Tangier, Morocco; includes photographs.
Camp Ramapo, 1955: materials relating to Rosenthal's summer job at Camp Ramapo; includes descriptions of the camp, schedules, notes, photographs of Rosenthal, and negatives.
Childhood, 1932-1948: materials from childhood and high-school years; includes stamp albums, programs, report cards, and high-school diploma.
Childhood, ca. 1932-1935: photographs of Rosenthal and family; removed from folder # 1.7.
Childhood, autograph collection, 1945: autographs and autograph book
Childhood, senior yearbook, 1948
College years, 1948-1952

note.p: Note: artwork removed to flat box # 3.1

did.unittitle: College years, 1948-1952: correspondence, admissions statement, test scores, report cards, papers, programs, clippings, gay bar ephemera
College years, Bob Curiel, 1951-1952: one love letter to Curiel and lyrics to song Curiel played on guitar
College years, design, 1950-1952: sketches, notes
College years, classics course, 1951: notes and papers for classical civilizations course
College years, private notes, 1950-1951: reading and thinking notes, quotes, notes, clippings on homosexuality
College years, psychological analyses, 1951-1952: analyses of himself and others
College years, writing, 1950-1952: poetry fragments, translations, beginning of a story
College years, artwork, 1951-1952: Rosenthal's drawings and sketches, mostly charcoal on newsprint.
Cuba
Cuba, 1960-1962: letters, clippings, typescripts, photograph
Cuba, The Debriefing, 1961: typescript by Rosenthal
Cuba, The PM Affair, 1961: typescript by Rosenthal
Cuba, Jose Marti, ca. 1961: photographs of Marti and his exhumation, pamphlet, Vindicacion de Cuba
Cuba, Bay of Pigs, 1961: photographs of invasion
Cuba, Havana, 1961: photographs by Rosenthal
Cuba, literary figures, 1960-1961: photographs of Pablo Neruda et al.; also meeting of artists and writers, including Rosenthal.
Cuba, Tumba Francesa, 1961: photographs of Cuban film
Declaration of Conscience Committee, 1961: letters by Philip Whalen, LeRoi Jones, et al.; also telegram, postcards, newsletter.
Dissertation correspondence and criticism, 1958: letters, dissertation proposal
Hare Krishna, 1967-1968: correspondence; includes ephemera, postcards, and photograph.
Healthcare in New York, 1959-1967: bills, receipts, identification cards, letters
Illinois Institute of Technology, 1954: letters, notes, drawing, report card
Job hunting, 1959-1962: letters, business cards, notes
Navy correspondence course evaluation project, 1952-1954: letters, notes, telegrams
New York City community college, 1965-1967: letter, student papers, notes, notebooks
New York City notes and documents, 1964-1967: address book, notebook, identification cards, draft of poem on envelope
Oahu, Hawaii, 1957: transcribed postcards
Programmed instruction, 1962: letters, notes
Salaries and taxes, 1948-1968: check stubs, tax forms, etc.
Selective Service, 1950-1952: letters and forms
Tangier, Morocco, 1962-1964: letters, notes, business card, photographs of Paul Bowles, Peter Birnbaum, Ira Cohen, Rosenthal, et al.
Teaching, Chicago, 1955-1957: notes, Rosenthal's transcripts, teaching materials, letters
Teaching, New York, 1962-1965: forms, notes, letters, teaching materials
U.S. Department of Agriculture, 1966: letters, clipping
University of Chicago, 1952-1958: letters, forms, transcripts, identification card, audograph disc
University of Chicago, Counseling Center, 1934-1954: letters, forms, and notes from Rosenthal's work as a counselor.
Series II. CORRESPONDENCE

scopecontent.p: This series contains incoming and outgoing correspondence. Rosenthal often made carbon copies of his outgoing correspondence, so many files in this series offer insight into the development of his personal and professional relationships with a number of prominent Beat figures, including Allen Ginsberg, Herbert Huncke, and William Burroughs. As an editor, much of Rosenthal's correspondence included the exchange of manuscripts and other materials. Rather than removing these items and placing them in a separate series, we have left all items with the correspondence files in order to preserve the original context of these materials. Accordingly, in addition to correspondence, this series contains a large number of manuscripts and typescripts, as well as artwork, photographs, booklets, periodicals, and ephemera.

did.unittitle: Alexander, Dorris, 1951-1952: extensive correspondence; includes artwork, clipping, invitation, and postcard.
Allan, Richard, 1952-1954: letters, greeting card
Allen, Donald, 1958-2000: correspondence, postcard
Ansen, Alan, 1958-1964: correspondence; includes typescript of "Running" and review of Gregory Corso's "Gasoline."
Aronowitz, Al, 1959-1997: correspondence; includes The Blacklisted Journalist (1997).
Arrabal, Fernando, 1959-1960: letter, flyers, photographs
Bassin, Barry, 1966-1968: extensive correspondence; includes clippings, magazine, Night, issues 1 and 2, (1968), porno press and Hare Krishna press fragments.
Bathhurst, Bill, 1966-1967: correspondence; includes typescript of poem, "HE."
Beckett, Samuel, 1958: letter
Benfield, Michael, 1966-1969: correspondence; includes copy of hospital admittance form and manuscript of poem, "Freedom Lost" written on a paper towel.

Birnbaum, Peter, 1964-1974: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, notebooks, photographs, artwork, and business cards.
Birnbaum, Peter, ca. 1964-1974: printing scraps, clippings, artwork
Birnbaum, Peter, 1968: Marbels from Cockaroch Morseleum by Isser Aronvici, published by Birnbaum.

Bowles, Paul, 1959-1978: extensive correspondence regarding life in Tangier, Morocco and Big Table submissions and publications; includes two photographs (one landscape, one of Bowles) and typescripts, "Ketama-taza" (1959) and "The Ball at Sidi Hosni" (ca. 1960).
Boyd, Robert, 1960-1961: note, typescripts of poems
Brand, Arlene, 1957-1961: correspondence; includes greeting card and Audograph FL-60 disc.
Breen, Walter, 1960: postcard
Bremser, Ray and Bonnie, 1958-1962: extensive correspondence; includes letter from Ray Bremser to Gregory Corso; also photographs, postcards, artwork, manuscripts, and typescripts.
Bremser, Ray, ca. 1959: typescript of "The Square"
Brenan, Gerald, 1964: letter
Brown, Chris, 1965-1968: correspondence, postcard
Brown, Geoffrey, 1966-1967: extensive correspondence; includes typescripts and photographs.
Brown, Geoffrey, 1967-1987: correspondence; includes typescripts and "A Free Book (But not without Cost)," a binder of poetry (1984), inscribed to Rosenthal.
Burroughs, William, 1958-1962

note.p: See also Big Table , folder # 33.4, for Naked Lunch typescripts

did.unittitle: Burroughs, 1958-1959: extensive correspondence, including correspondence between Burroughs, Rosenthal, Allen Ginsberg, et al., regarding the publication of Naked Lunch in The Chicago Review and Big Table and by Olympia and Grove Press; includes typescript portions of Naked Lunch, some with edits by Allen Ginsberg and Rosenthal; proofs for The Chicago Review; also publication offers, legal papers, and Burroughs's artwork.

Burroughs, 1959-1961: extensive correspondence, including Burroughs, Rosenthal, Allen Ginsberg, et al.; includes Rosenthal's notes on editing Naked Lunch submitted to Grove Press; also typescripts, telegram, publication offers, clippings, proofs, contract, Burroughs's artwork, and notices of seizure for Naked Lunch and The Soft Machine.

Burroughs, loose typescripts, 1958-1960: portions of Naked Lunch, including "The Hospital," "Soul Crackers," and "The Examination," some with edits by Burroughs and Rosenthal (ca. 1958); also fragment with edits by Gregory Corso and "Conspiracy" title page (dropped from Naked Lunch "Hospital" section) with edits by Allen Ginsberg.
Burroughs, typescript, 1959: "Queer" from Naked Lunch with edits by Burroughs and Allen Ginsberg; also biographical notes.
Burroughs, typescript, 1959: "In Search of Yage" from Naked Lunch with edits by Burroughs and Allen Ginsberg.
Burroughs, The Naked Lunch, 1959: published by Olympia Press; first copy to enter US; contains Rosenthal's edits throughout; used by Burroughs as base manuscript for Grove edition.
Burroughs, My Own Mag, 1960: zine with drawing of Burroughs on the cover; pages 3-4 edited by Burroughs.
Cabrera Infante, Guillermo, 1961: letters
Cabrera Infante, Guillermo, 1961: photographs removed from folder # 6.8
Capote, Truman, 1958-1959: letters, telegram, postcards
Carroll, Paul, 1957-1959: extensive correspondence; includes notes, clipping, telegrams.
Carroll, Paul, 1959: extensive correspondence; includes telegrams.
Carroll, Paul, 1960-1988: correspondence; includes notes, telegrams, postcards, clipping.
Casey, Calvert, 1961: letter
Chester, Alfred, 1964: letters, note
Ciardi, John, 1959: letters, galley proof, clipping
Clay, Mel, 1964: correspondence; includes typescript of poem.
Cohen, Ira, 1963-1989: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, prints.
Cohen, Ira, Nexus, 1998: vol. 33, no. 2, dedication to Rosenthal in 2001.
Conner, Bruce, ca. 1960: correspondence; includes mail art, brochures, exhibition announcements, catalogs, clippings, and artwork.

Corso, Gregory, 1958-2001: correspondence; includes typescripts of a review of Doctor Sax by Jack Kerouac and of "On Chessman's Crime" (1960); also postcards, clippings, two obituaries and tributes to Corso in Poetry Flash (2001).

note.p: See also Big Table, folder # 33.4, for Corso typescripts

did.unittitle: Corso, Gregory, 1959: six photographs of 1959 poetry reading; the photographs picture Corso, Jack Kerouac, Ray and Bonnie Bremser, et al.; removed from folder # 7.11.
Coulter, Michael, ca. 1966-1967: extensive correspondence; includes business card, photographs, and artwork, felt-tip sketches and drawings for Pole Vault by Edward Marshall.

Curiel, Robert, 1951-1989: correspondence
Curley, A., 1957-1958: correspondence; includes notes and cards.

Dahlberg, Edward, 1958-1977: extensive correspondence; includes clippings, postcards, and typescripts: "Tears of the Virgin" (ca. 1959); "Because I was Flesh," (one page and scrap with Rosenthal's edits); Dahlberg's biography.

note.p: See also Big Table , folder # 33.4, for Dahlberg typescripts

did.unittitle: Dahlberg, Edward, Sewanee Review, 1959: no. 2, inscribed to Rosenthal
Dahlberg, Edward, TriQuarterly, 1970: no. 19; issue dedicated to Dahlberg.
Dahlberg, Julia, 1965-1993: correspondence; includes postcards, greeting cards, business cards, legal papers, and photographs.
Dahlberg, R'Lene, 1959-1982: correspondence; includes postcards and galley proof of Allen Ginsberg's introduction to Leave the Word Alone by Ed Marshall.
Deemer, Bill, 1968: letters, postcard
DeFanti, Charles, 1972-1974: correspondence
Di Prima, Diane, 1960-1969: letter to Allen Ginsberg, greeting card, typescript, "Thinks on Westernness"

Dorfman, Elsa, 1960-2000: correspondence; includes drafts of statements about poetry by nine poets for the Paterson Society; also postcards of Dorfman's photographs and photocopied articles from Views: The Journal of Photography in New England (1981).
Dowden, George, 1960-1966: letters
Dragudze, Tamara, 1963-1965: letters
Edelstein, Richard, 1951-1954: extensive correspondence
Elkin, Gay, 1949-1952: correspondence; includes greeting cards and a reprint of "Transvestism: An Empirical Study" by Louise Lawrence, from International Journal of Sexology (1951).
Ferlinghetti, Lawrence, 1958-1964: correspondence, including letters regarding the suppression of the 1959 winter issue of The Chicago Review; also City Lights Books postcards.
Fisher, Melvin, 1967: extensive correspondence; includes correspondence with Rosenthal, Geoffrey Brown, the Fisher Family, et al.; includes manuscripts, and artwork
Fisher, Melvin, 1967-1976: extensive correspondence
Fisher, Melvin, ca. 1967-1968: photographs removed from folders # 8.14-8.15 of Melvin Fisher, Geoffrey Brown, et al.; photostrips of Melvin Fisher, Rosenthal, et al.

Fles, John, 1958-1962: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, telegram, The Trembling Lamb (1960), edited by John Fles; also includes typescript of "The Remembers," a story about Ray and Bonnie Bremser, and typescript of "The Boom" (1962).
Forbes, Sumner, 1962: note, letter
Ford, Charles Henri, View, 1945: Series 5, No. 1
Ford, Charles Henri, 1965-1984: correspondence; includes posters, artwork, and postcards.
Foster, Pat, 1948: card, clipping
Fusco, Peter, 1966-1967: photostrip of Rosenthal and Peter Fusco, note, letter, manuscript, "O Perverted Generation"
Ginsberg, Allen, 1949-1999

note.p: Note: oversized periodical removed to flat box # 3.2.

did.unittitle: Ginsberg, 1949-1959: typescript "Patterson" (ca. 1949); extensive correspondence; includes correspondence regarding William Burroughs, Gregory Corso, Gary Snyder, Jack Kerouac, Robert Creeley, Alan Ansen, et al.; correspondence regarding the suppression of the 1959 winter issue of The Chicago Review and Rosenthal's resignation; Jargon 31: 14 Poets, 1 Artist (1958).

Ginsberg, 1959-1965: extensive correspondence; includes correspondence regarding Big Table, Ginsberg's travels in India, and Rosenthal's stay in Tangier, Morocco; also includes Ginsberg's feedback on Sheeper; typescript of poem, "Kali Ma" (ca. 1963).

Ginsberg, 1966-1971: extensive correspondence; includes correspondence regarding Herbert Huncke, Don Allen, Jack Smith, et al.; clipped articles about Ginsberg; Village Voice, "Hustler for Life" (1966); Life, "The Guru Comes to Kansas" (1966); transcription of taped recording; includes discussion between Rosenthal and Ginsberg about the 1967 Arab-Israeli War.

Ginsberg, photographs, 1962-1971: photographs of Ginsberg's travels in India sent to Marc Schleifer with captions on back (1962); mounted photograph, Allen Ginsberg singing at the Blue Angel Cabaret in San Francisco (1971); removed from folders # 9.8-9.9.
Ginsberg, 1971: typescripts for "Interrogation of a Businessman by the Interior Police" (interview of Ginsberg by Rosenthal).

Ginsberg, 1973-1992: extensive correspondence; includes letters in defense of Abbie Hoffman; posters; Little Free Press pamphlets; memorandum of a North Beach conversation between Rosenthal, Ginsberg, and Serge Grenier (1981); programs for poetry readings; clipping; copy of Rosenthal's inscription in Ginsberg's copy of Sheeper.
Ginsberg, 1994-1999: correspondence; clippings; exhibit announcements; ICA newsletter; Rosenthal's notes from last visit with Ginsberg.
Ginsberg, Village Voice, 1997: vol. 42, no. 15; includes memorial feature, "Remembering Allen Ginsberg."
Ginsberg, Allen Ginsberg Reads Kaddish, 1966: LP record, inscribed by Ginsberg to Rosenthal
Gitana, Nina, 1960: greeting card, letters
Goodman, Paul, 1960: typescript, "The Fate of Dr. Reich's Books (The Injunction against Reich's Books)," appeared in Kulcher 2 (1960).
Grady, Panna, 1966-1968: correspondence; includes greeting cards.
Gurin, David, 1961-1968: extensive correspondence; includes notes, postcards, and four typescripts by "A. Burgereau"; also Gurin's comments on Sheeper.
Gurin, David, 1968-1999: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, clippings, and greeting cards.
Gurin, David, 1959-1999: photographs of David Gurin and others removed from folders # 10.4-10.5.
Haber, Daniel, ca. 1967-1980: correspondence; includes artwork, postcards, and photograph.
Hall, Tevelda, 1955-1959: correspondence; includes flyer.
Hamburger, Michael, 1958: letters

Hasselwood, Dave, 1959-1981: extensive correspondence; includes artwork, flyer, photographs, and typescript "The Current Fall of the Social World."

Huncke, Herbert, 1959-1973
Huncke, 1961-1962, Huncke-Rosenthal correspondence: extensive correspondence; includes transcripts of "Forty Thieves" and "Argument between Huncke and Irving"; artwork, notes, and greeting card.
Huncke, 1965-1968, Huncke-Rosenthal correspondence: extensive correspondence; includes correspondence regarding Huncke's Ching; flyer for Huncke's Journal (1965) and postcards.

Huncke, 1959-1960, other correspondence: extensive correspondence; includes correspondence with Mollie Collins, Allen Ginsberg, Peter Orlovsky, Jack Kerouac, et al.; telegram, notes, postcards, receipts, and legal papers.
Huncke, 1961, other correspondence: extensive correspondence; includes correspondence with Janine Pommy, Howard Schulman, et al.; artwork by Arnold Levin and postcards.
Huncke, 1961, other correspondence: extensive correspondence; includes correspondence with Elizabeth Sutherland, Janine Pommy, et al.; includes artwork by Janine Pommy and Arnold Levin.
Huncke, 1961-1966, miscellaneous manuscripts and typescripts: includes manuscripts and notes for portions of Huncke's Ching, including "Burroughs," "Herbert E. Huncke/Hunks/H.E.H.," and others.

Huncke, 1966-1967, miscellaneous manuscripts and typescripts: includes manuscripts, "Bill Burroughs, Wm. S. Burroughs, Alias Bull Lee" and others; also includes typescript, "The Mysterious He" and Huncke's first notes on Huncke's Ching.
Huncke, Herbert, 1967, miscellaneous manuscripts and typescripts: includes artwork by Huncke and correspondence.
Huncke, 1963-1965: loose typescripts
Huncke, 1965: typescript of Huncke's Journal
Huncke, 1966: "Green Notebook" typescripts
Huncke, 1966: typescripts of "Burroughs" and "Bill Burroughs, Wm. S. Burroughs, Alias Bull Lee"

Huncke, ca. 1966: compilation of all Huncke's typescripts through 1966 (Rosenthal notes that this is the most complete set; 20 pages are missing); includes some pieces published in Huncke's Journal and many pieces included in Huncke's Ching, as well as additional fragments and untitled pieces. (3 folders)

Huncke, ca. 1966: compilation of all Huncke's typescripts through 1966 (Rosenthal notes that this is a less complete set; around 50 pages are missing); includes some pieces published in Huncke's Journal and many pieces included in Huncke's Ching, as well as additional fragments and untitled pieces. (2 folders)
Huncke, 1966-1967: contains index cards listing information about Huncke's manuscripts.
Huncke, 1966-1967: loose typescripts (5 folders)
Huncke, 1967: contains the typescript of Huncke's Ching offered to Grove Press. (2 folders)
Huncke, 1973: contains duplicate of restored Huncke's Ching typescript. (2 folders)

Itkin, Michael, 1966-1969: letter, booklet, flyer, greeting card
Johnson, Ray, 1961-1995: correspondence, flyers
Jones, LeRoi, 1960-1966: correspondence; includes postcard, clipping, typescript of "Cuba Libra" published in Kulcher 2 (1960).

note.p: Also known as Baraka, Imamu Amiri.

Orlovsky, Marie, 1961: letters, note
Orlovsky, Peter, 1959-1978: correspondence; includes postcards.
Page, Marjorie, 1956-1959: correspondence; includes postcards and clipping.
Persky, Stan, 1960-1961: letters
Pitschel, Barbara, 1957-1968: correspondence; includes postcards.
Pitschel, Roland, 1958-1959: letters, telegram, postcard
Plimpton, George, 1964-1965: letters
Plymell, Charles, 1967: typescript for Glamorous Novelties
Podell, Albert, 1958-1961: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, telegrams, clippings.
Pommy, Janine, 1961-1967: notes, typescript
Rechy, John, 1959-1962: correspondence; includes clippings.
Rexroth, Kenneth, 1958: letter
Richkin, Robert, 1967-1969: galley proof, letters, typescript, manuscript
Riesman, David, 1957-1958: correspondence
Rogers, Carl, 1952-1956: correspondence; includes notes and copy of research proposal.
Rogers Pugh, Harriet, 1955-1957: letters, postcard, greeting card
Romagnolo, Fred, 1949-1959: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, telegram, greeting cards, photographs.

Rosenthal, Belle and Sidney (Rosenthal's parents), 1921-1982: correspondence; includes Sidney's operator's license, telegram, greeting cards, copy of clipping, letter from Belle to Allen Ginsberg, copy of Belle's will.
Safro, Malka, 1960-1961: letters, postcards
Sanders, Edward, 1950-1957: extensive correspondence
Sanders, Melvin, 1951-1963: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, greeting card, telegrams.
Schleifer, Marc, 1958-1962: extensive correspondence; includes broadside, telegrams, typescript, photograph, galley proofs, poster.
Schleifer, Marc, 1962-1982: extensive correspondence; includes clippings, flyers, photographs.
Schleifer, Marc, poetry reading project, 1959: correspondence; includes notes, telegrams, flyer, postcard.
Schleifer, Marc, letters from Marian Zazeela, 1958-1962; extensive correspondence includes typescripts, photographs, slides, The Monthly Review, vol. 13, nos. 3 and 4 (1961).
Schleifer, Marc, letters to Marian Zazeela, 1961-1962: extensive correspondence; includes notes.
Schlesinger, Arthur, 1958-1961: letters
Schulman, Howard, 1959-1962: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, typescripts, Pa'lante, no.1 (1962).
Schulman, Howard, 1962-1985: extensive correspondence; includes flyer, telegram, postcards, typescript.
Skir, Leo, 1962-1969: extensive correspondence; includes typescripts for memoir, postcards, notes, photographs (contact sheet).
Smalakis, Laura, 1954-1958: correspondence; includes postcards, greeting cards
Smith, Jack, 1958-1996
Smith, 1961: correspondence; includes typescript transcriptions of taped conversations between Smith, Rosenthal, Herbert Huncke, others; also notes, membership card.
Smith, 1962: correspondence; includes copies of letters from Smith to David Gurin; also notes and Scene, vol. 8, no. 2.

Smith, 1963-1975: extensive correspondence; includes copy of "Rehearsal for the Destruction of Atlantis"; also clippings, flyers, notes, Film-Makers Cooperative catalogue (1963), inscribed to Rosenthal.
Smith, 1977-1989: extensive correspondence; includes clippings, notes, flyers, postcards, photograph.
Smith, 1989-1996: letters, notes, clippings, obituaries, Rosenthal's phone interviews with Jack Smith's sister, Mary Sue Slater
Smith, 1959: mounted photograph of Jerry Sims
Smith, photographs 1960: photographs of Smith, one on collage
Smith, contact sheets, 1960-1961: contact sheets for photo shoots picturing Rene Rivera (Mario Montez), Marian Zazeela, et al., some with tape to indicate cropping and framing
Smith, photographs, 1961: photographs and negatives of Rosenthal and Reese Haire
Smith, photographs, ca. 1959-1966: black and white photographs of Mario Montez, Rosenthal, Reese Haire, Isabel Eberstadt, et al.
Smith, mounted photograph, ca. 1958: color photograph of two costumed figures in Lincoln Center rubble.
Smith, mounted photograph, ca. 1958: color photograph of costumed figure leaning on a platter.
Smith, Sheeper photographs, 1967: photographs of Rosenthal for Sheeper dust jacket; note by Rosenthal describes re-touching of photographs
Smith, artwork and ephemera, ca. 1961-1966: drawings, cartoons, booklets, flyers; includes flyer for Flaming Creatures, negative of Mario Montez.
Smith, The Beautiful Book, 1962: booklet with photos by Smith
Smith, artwork and ephemera, ca. 1966-1970: drawings and designs for Glamorous Novelties, Sheeper, Marbels from Cockaroch Morseleum, others; also includes cartoons and flyers.
Smith, Dreamweapon, 1962: booklet by Angus Maclise with Smith photographs printed on paper; poster originally folded into booklet.
Smith, press plates, 1966-1968: aluminum press plates for Hollow Prescenium Mountain, No President, and business card.
Smith, manila folder project, 1967: artwork on manila folders
Smith, Avalanche, 1974: art magazine with spread by Smith
Smith, posters, 1976-1984: posters for Smith's productions; includes The Secret of Rented Island, I was a Male Yvonne de Carlo, others.
Smith, Art-Rite, 1975-1978: nos. 11, 12 (1975-1976); includes short article on Jack Smith, "American Tourister"; no. 19 (1978); includes text and art by Smith, "Capitalism of Lotusland."
Smith, ca. 1961: costume garment
Smith, ca. 1961: costume garments; sent to Rosenthal after Smith's death.
Smith, publicity packet, 1987: copies of press clippings and flyers; includes draft of cover note and note by Jeanette Szudy.
Smith, 1988: typescript dissertation chapter on Smith by Uzi Parnes
Smith, 1996: typescript essay on Smith by Lawrence Rinder; includes letter to Rosenthal.
Snyder, Gary, 1958: letters
Solomon, Carl, 1960: letter, note
Solomon, Freude and Norman: 1961-1962: correspondence; includes postcards, notes, unopened letter from Freude to Elise Cowan (opened in 2008 during processing).
Sourelis, Stan, 1959: letters, postcard, greeting card
Spellman, A. B., 1960: typescript of poem published in Kulcher 2.
Standal, Stanley, 1953-1961: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, greeting cards, photographs, portion of Standal's dissertation.
Stubenhaus, Abbe, 1967-1974: letters, typescripts, postcards, wedding prayer book
Sturz, Herbert, 1951-1983: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, greeting cards.
Sutherland, Elizabeth, 1961: letters
Suzuki, D.T., 1958: typescript, "Rinzai on Zen"
Taylor, Simon Watson, 1959: greeting card, note, postcard
Tedesco, Claudia, 1969-1986: letters, postcards, greeting cards, photographs
Turnbull, Gael, 1958: letter
Usdansky, George, 1955-1960: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, clippings, audograph disc.
Waring, James, 1960-1961: letter, note, typescript
Whalen, Philip, 1958-2002: extensive correspondence; includes postcards, notes, artwork, obituaries.
Whalen, Philip, A Commentary, 1960: one page poster-sized manuscript
Whalen, Philip, Invention of the Letter, 1966: manuscript of hand-drawn book and final copy for reproduction
Whalen, Philip, Invention of the Letter, 1967: copies of uncut pages
Whalen, Philip, Winning His Way, 1967: manuscript of hand-drawn book with cover letter
Whalen, Philip, Winning His Way, 1982-1983: pre-press drawings, plates, and proofs
Whiteman, Ruth, 1954: letter, postcard, notes
Wieners, John, 1959-1961: extensive correspondence; includes letters to Freude Solomon and others; also manuscripts, notes, telegram, clippings.

Wieners, John, 1961-2002: extensive correspondence; includes letters to Freude Solomon and others; also manuscript, flyers, clippings, greeting cards, Zarza, April, 1961, Measure, no. 3, 1962, "In Memoriam John Wieners," 2002.
Williams, Jonathan, 1958-1978: letters, postcards, greeting cards, newsletter
Yarborough, Ernest, 1957: photocopy of postcard, greeting card
Yglesias, Jose, 1952-1961: letters, business card
Zazeela, Marian, 1957-1961: extensive correspondence; includes artwork, typescript, notes, theater program, photograph of Zazeela and Rosenthal.
Zazeela, Marian, 1962-2000: extensive correspondence; includes artwork, manuscript, theater program, flyers, posters.
Zinn, Marjorie, 1956-1969: postcard, letters, Ebony, March 1956 and Tan, July, 1958
Series III. MISCELLANEOUS CORRESPONDENCE

scopecontent.p: This small series consists of materials that Rosenthal marked as miscellaneous, and mostly contains limited correspondence and ephemera. The letter in the folder titles refers to the first letter of the correspondents' last name.

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous A, 1953-1961: letters, receipts, artwork, hand-printed booklet
Miscellaneous B, ca. 1949-1968: correspondence; includes flyer and postcard
Miscellaneous C, ca. 1950-1972: correspondence; includes receipts and Rosenthal's 1966 calendar.
Miscellaneous D, 1969: letter
Miscellaneous G, ca. 1952-1967: letters, postcards
Miscellaneous H, ca. 1952-1967: correspondence; includes postcards and invitations.
Miscellaneous I and J: correspondence; includes greeting card and poster.
Miscellaneous K, 1952-1970: correspondence; includes greeting card, postcard, photograph of Bonnie Bremser; also Kerista Speeler, vol. 1, issue 3 (1964).
Miscellaneous L, 1956-1959: telegram, letter, postcard
Miscellaneous M, 1960-1967: letters, postcards
Miscellaneous N, 1965-1966: letter, invitation
Miscellaneous O, 1958-1959: letters
Miscellaneous P, 1955-1960: letters, postcards, manuscript, greeting cards
Miscellaneous R, 1957-1967: letters, typescripts
Miscellaneous S, 1957-1972: letters, newsletter, drawing, greeting card
Miscellaneous T, 1953-1971: ticket for Dylan Thomas reading, letters
Miscellaneous W, 1958-1963: letters, greeting card, business card
Series IV. PROFFESIONAL

scopecontent.p: This series contains materials specifically related to Rosenthal's work as an editor, publisher, and writer. It includes correspondence and typescripts from his editorial work at The Chicago Review, Big Table, and other publications. It also contains drafts and proofs of Sheeper, as well as correspondence regarding its publication.

did.unittitle: Auerhahn Press, 1959-1960: flyer, postcards
Big Table, 1958-1959
Big Table, 1958-1959: correspondence; includes clipping, poster, and notes.
Big Table, distribution, 1958-1959: correspondence; includes postcard, invoice, notes, and distribution list.

Big Table, typescripts, 1959: typescripts for Big Table no. 1; includes typescripts by William Burroughs, Gregory Corso, Jack Kerouac, and Rosenthal (material intended for suppressed 1959 winter edition of The Chicago Review).
Big Table; production, 1959: notes, artwork, letter, receipt
Big Table, galley proofs, 1959: galley proofs for Big Table no. 1
Big Table, Harry Gantt, 1959: correspondence with Harry Gantt, publisher and printer; includes notes, receipt, telegram, and postcards.
Big Table, ACLU: materials relating to court case over the suppression of Big Table by the US Post Office; includes correspondence, telegram, pamphlet, and copy of judge's decision.
Big Table, 1959: no. 1
Book of Grass, 1967: letters
Carp and Whitefish, 1965-1969: correspondence; includes artwork, clipping, invoices, and loose pages and cover of receipt book.
Chicago Review, 1957-1959
Chicago Review, 1957: extensive correspondence; includes notes, manuscripts, typescripts, including typescript for "Invitation to Sleep" by Rosenthal published in The Chicago Review, spring 1957.
Chicago Review, photographs, 1957: photographs of staff, including Rosenthal; removed from folder # 33.12.
Chicago Review, 1958-1959: extensive correspondence; includes poster, notes, clippings, and committee report regarding the suppression of The Chicago Review.
Chicago Review, 1957-1958: vol. 11, no. 1, no. 4
Chicago Review, spring 1958, vol. 12, no. 1-3
Glamorous Novelties, 1966: notes, typescripts
Sheeper, 1959-1990
Drafts, 1959-1967: early and rejected drafts; includes manuscripts, typescripts, notebooks. (5 folders)
Typescript, 1963: pages 1-80
Typescript, 1963: chapters 54, 55
Typescript, 1963: sent to Eila Kokkinen from Tangier.
Typescript, 1963: sent to Michael McClure from Tangier; includes note to McClure.
Typescript, 1963: first complete typescript (2 folders)
Gnaoua, 1964: no. 1; includes passages from Sheeper.
Grove Press, 1964-1975: extensive correspondence regarding the publication of Sheeper; includes contracts, clippings; also letter from Herbert Huncke and others.
Typescript, ca. 1965: 68 pages
Akzente, 1966: vol. 13, no.6 and special issue; includes chapters from Sheeper.
Evergreen Review, 1967: vol. 11, no. 46; includes sections from Sheeper.
Floating Bear Newsletter, 1967: no. 33; includes chapter from Sheeper.
Growing Hand, 1967: includes chapter from Sheeper
Typescript, 1967: final typescript submitted to Grove Press. (2 folders)
Les Episodes, 2001: no. 11; includes chapters from Sheeper.
Galley proofs, 1967: corrected by Rosenthal
Page proofs, 1967
Page proofs, 1967: corrected by Rosenthal.
Reviews, 1967-1969: clippings
Fan mail and solicitations, 1965-1970: letters, postcards
Draft, 1990: copy of first draft of 1990 revision
Galley proofs, 1967: revisions by Rosenthal; used as base for 1990 edition.
